page.title: 03STREAMS AND INSECTS BALMEDIE
page.content: Just behind our school there flows the Egie burn. The burn is 15cm deep in the middle and 10cm deep at the north and south sides.The weather is very windy and dull. The temperature of the burn was 80C. These are some of the insects we found in the burn water beetle, gnat pupa, damsel fly nymph,stone fly larva, mayfly, gnat larva,midge larva, freshwater worm and a water mite.The insects that do not live in water are house flies, beetles, wasps, bees, greenflies, earwigs, midgies,centipedes and worms. Insects like flies come in summer and go away in late summer or early autumn.
